items.title: Transformers as Approximate Wasserstein Gradient Flows (with viscous NS vibes)
items.summary: Sketching the view that vanilla transformers approximate a Wasserstein gradient flow with a viscous Navier–Stokes regularizer; notes, heuristics, and open problems.

items.title: Benamou–Brenier vs Fisher–Rao: Geodesics in OT and IG
items.summary: Explores how Benamou–Brenier geodesics in Wasserstein space compare to Fisher–Rao geodesics in information geometry, and when they coincide.

items.title: Reflexive Mean Field Emergence
items.summary: Mapping psychological concepts like aesthetics, morality, and consciousness onto mean-field dynamics and compression-based dualities.

items.title: From Displacement Convexity to Lasry–Lions Monotonicity
items.summary: Gives a rigorous proof that λ-displacement convexity implies strong Lasry–Lions monotonicity and deduces uniqueness and contraction for potential MFG equilibria.

items.title: The Helmholtz Transformer
items.summary: Part 1 formalizes attention-as-diffusion and MLP-as-conservative drift on the sphere, yielding a testable Fokker–Planck model with Schrödinger-bridge editing.
